body: Thanks @zhigaowu !
@tqchen could you help to merge it next? Thanks.

ok I found a dirty hack to remove prim::CallMethod. Add
```torch._C._jit_pass_inline(trace.graph)```
after tracing. This will move operators hidden inside each prim::CallMethod into top level.
Yes. I think we miss it.

Hi, I am building MXNet with TVM on Windows to support TVMOps. Building LLVM from source with Visual Studio 2017 or later would result in errors due to different constexpr standards, so I have built LLVM and TVM with Clang-CL + Ninja + MSVC LINK/RC, (which means you need to install LLVM binary first). However I'm still having some post build issues when generating tvmop.dll, e.g., unresolved external symbol __gnu_h2f_ieee, the function is disabled on MSVC in tvm runtime.
Thanks @LiangHao151941 @cchung100m
Thanks @wyc-ruiker @FrozenGene
Yes, we should add it, a PR is more than welcomed
@kevinthesun do you have any updates?
@anijain2305 , @jackwish can you take a look at this.

> @jmorrill how would you feel about working toward merging this into public TVM? It's important functionality.

I think that could be worthwhile (and fun)!  I am using it currently...and it performs very close to the Linux codepaths. 

Though let me know if you feel the same after you've seen some of the nasty I've had to add to make it work :).
I've taken a look :) I'm not super familiar with a lot of the areas that you touched, but I think we can move this from a draft PR to an open PR and include some other people to comment.
Thanks for asking the question, please open a new trouble shooting thread on https://discuss.tvm.ai/

close this for now. Thanks @xqdan 

The new Unified IR RFC #4617 covers this aspect, by using relay's Op as a single source to register the related information. 

The follow up refactors will be able to reflect that

cc @yzhliu feel free to merge after fixing the nits. BTW, it also reminds me if we would like to bring IterVar as a sub-class of Var, right now it takes Var as a member.

Thanks for this useful feature @huajsj . I think that in the long terms this pass will need to be re-written; but for now this will fix the gap.

One thing I'd like to add is the possibility of passing the `-1` index to refer to the last occurrence of the operator in the network. Would that be possible to do?

@ZihengJiang thanks for the feedback! The TFLite Interpreter still has `AllocateTensors`; however I wan't sure if we'd ever need to call it separately from interpreter initialization. If you believe that we need to decouple them, I can revert the interface change.
cc @yzhliu @ZihengJiang @wweic @zhiics
would be great if @wweic can also take a look

Looks like this change breaks the following snippet:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/blob/49d31443c4b65c814a3da6decc363a881c05b372/tests/python/frontend/tensorflow/test_forward.py#L2352-L2354

The `size_value` variable is set to `2` (0D tensor) so `size_tensor` should have been `(2,)` (1D tensor). But currently, the TF frontend seems to silently ignore `tf.expand_dims`; `size_tensor` is simply set to `2`.  So the current "auto-boxing" behavior of the TF frontend is actually necessary for many op implementations to work.

Ideal fix would be to make strict distinction between 1D `(1,)` tensors and 0D tensors. Unfortunately, I do not currently have bandwidth to perform the necessary audit of the TF frontend.
@ZihengJiang I should have addressed all of your comments by now; let me know if you're happy with the changes

In some cases relay.build hangs. The issue caused by `topi/python/topi/x86/dense.py` [Line 194](https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/blob/master/topi/python/topi/x86/dense.py#L194).

More info https://discuss.tvm.ai/t/relay-build-hangs-for-5d-max-pool3d-reshape-matmul/5398
@tqchen Yes, I'll send a follow up PR.
I'll take a look soon.
@wweic sorry for the delay, I am busy submitting to ICML, please go ahead.
Thanks @tqchen I'll take a look into the IndexVar and send another pr

Sorry I missed a few things at the beginning and just added them.

Do you mean translating this part line by line, https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/blob/master/python/tvm/build_module.py#L509-L650?

Some of the type checks are not needed in C++, and the signature of https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/blob/bfb4884e47f7d2c759b2ee707aa18acf35116380/python/tvm/relay/backend/_backend.py#L65-L88 is a lot simpler.

Also, 
https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/blob/master/python/tvm/build_module.py#L635-L650 has been implemented in here https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/blob/master/src/codegen/build_module.cc#L278-L319. All I need to do is call this function.

I know very little about tvm Module and relay build, so I might get something wrong.
But it seems like you replace 27 line with 47 line, but they are implemented completely differently - one call another function while another does lots of work. Any reason for this?

@tmoreau89 As shown in [my last commit](https://ci.tvm.ai/blue/organizations/jenkins/tvm/detail/PR-4407/21/pipeline/37) , all VTA tests are successful with TSIM backend.

The latest CI log is reporting failure because we have verilator and sbt installed on docker image v0.55 , but not on v0.52 .

Looks good, please feel free to send a PR

@hlu1 Can we simply remove this packed function and directly invoke tvm::build from compile_engine and interpreter? We have two separate pipelines from Python and C++. I think we can probably directly use tvm.build from python and tvm::build from C++. So we don't really need to interoperate between them.
waiting for @tqchen's approval
Looks good! Thanks! @tmoreau89
cc @MarisaKirisame and @slyubomirsky

Should we also change the namespace for python?
We should, but I hope to that as a followup. related https://discuss.tvm.ai/t/tvm-python-project-organization-after-unified-ir/5383
@zhiics, makes sense. Will do.
thanks @comaniac @zhiics @tqchen

> Also do you mind referencing the PR that updates the docker image for future reference?

Please refer to #4674 for installing verilator and sbt, #4675 for installing their dependencies, and #4677 for using the new image in CI.
Cool, thanks. Since the PRs have been merged, is there a reason why we are still using the old docker image which causes CI to fail?
I think docker image v0.52 is for i386, and it has no svt and verilator install. Previous docker update v0.55 is for x86-64.
Oh so you're saying that we cannot run tsim tests on `i386` then? Should we disable the tsim tests for i386 then?

> Oh so you're saying that we cannot run tsim tests on `i386` then? Should we disable the tsim tests for i386 then?

Yes, but I'm not quite sure about how to do this.

I can suggest the following: we can have a `task_python_vta_fsim.sh` and a `task_python_vta_tsim.sh` script that are each separate. One thing we'll need to do before executing tests is to add the `cp vta/config/fsim_sample.json vta/config/vta_config.json` or `cp vta/config/tsim_sample.json vta/config/vta_config.json`first wether we execute fsim or tsim respectively. This ensures that if someone re-orders the tests, functionality won't be affected...
@jroesch @tqchen @wweic comments are addressed. PTAL, thanks.
Thanks @tmoreau89 @zhiics for the detail review! I've addressed the comments. Please take another pass as your earliest convenience.
I suggest we can follow a two-pass approach. For the first pass, get a list of named operator occurrence; then locate the subgraph by counting operator occurrence.
Sure, let's follow this approach.
Apologies. Will take a look at it again next week.
Thanks @anijain2305 @jwfromm

> I suggest we can follow a two-pass approach. For the first pass, get a list of named operator occurrence; then locate the subgraph by counting operator occurrence.

Hi @liangfu , I try this feature couple times, and feel the way to count operator occurrence times is not very convenience,  and using the index directly is more straight forward and efficiency, the two-pass way may work but that add additional logic and make the solution too heavy,  I would recommend to keep current one pass logic.

Regards
Hua
waiting further comments from @jroesch @wweic
@liangfu great! Can you also update the jenkins file? Please grep for `task_python_vta.sh` in the Jenkins file, and for `i386` keep the `fsim` tests, while for `x86_64` add both. Thanks!
Hi @zhiics and @FrozenGene , we have updated the code for the comments. Would you like to review again when you are free?
it would be great if you could add an test case on end to end network translation like in our tflite test case.
@tmoreau89 Jenkinsfile has been revised, but why Jenkins is still evaluating `task_python_vta.sh` ?
hmmm that's odd; try re-triggering it one more time?

> Looks good, please feel free to send a PR

Hi, I have created a PR. See
https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/pull/4731

I come to understand the reason now. Although PR #4677 changed the image to v0.55, Jenkins still runs on [v0.54](https://ci.tvm.ai/blue/organizations/jenkins/tvm/detail/PR-4677/1/pipeline/37) on that PR. Therefore, I think Jenkins is a step late to run everything in Jenkinsfile.

For that reason, I've duplicated a copy of task_python_vta_fsim.sh as task_python_vta.sh for now. Once this is merged, we can remove the task_python_vta.sh in a follow up PR, or you might prefer merge #4734 first.
@shoubhik Good catch about the index. Comments addressed.
@jmorrill I think we could break it into a few PRs. For example, cpp_rpc windows support could be one. AutoTVM windows support could be one.

How to test correctness  of `oshape` calculation in `src/relay/op/nn/pooling.cc`? What test file is responsible for that? I tried to check output shape in [topi/tests/python/test_topi_pooling.py](https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/blob/master/topi/tests/python/test_topi_pooling.py#L288) but looks like it is not using formula defined in `pooling.cc`.
Thanks for the change. It now look right.

ConvertLayout only support NHWC(tf) -> NCHW(tvm), but I used mxnet to make the layout conversion manually, and it turned out even slower. 

I think there is something to do with NVIDIA driver, I can still see layout conversion in nvprof.

https://docs.tvm.ai/dev/convert_layout.html

Please use the above tutorial to add support for nchw to nhwc layout.
Thanks @zhiics @tqchen @wweic @jroesch @MarisaKirisame . This is now merged.
